Architecture Notes

  • No native concept of translation
    • Content items do not support a native notion of translated content
    • This is ultimately done by linking the translations to the source
      • sometimes by designating a language as the source and translations link to the id of the source
      • sometimes by introducing a whole new identifier that is common to both
    • We could take this approach, but we did not
    • This approach relies on the location of content in the content source tree
      • The system will look up a translation in the same location as the source, but with a different prefix corresponding to the language
        • Current implementation just uses a 2-letter locale code, but you can use full locale codes too.
      • So what do you do when the item requested is not present in the desired locale?
        • Crafter falls back to a designated language for the site
          • e.g. if /jp/style is not present, it will return /en/style
